business.headline: Switzerland cancels 'most favoured nation' status to India over Nestle ruling The Swiss government has suspended the MFN clause in its tax treaty with India, potentially leading to higher taxes on Indian companies operating in Switzerland. This move follows a Supreme Court ruling affecting the interpretation of the MFN clause.
Bill Gates to go bankrupt? Tesla CEO Elon Musk explains howElon Musk claims Bill Gates could face bankruptcy over his alleged Tesla short position if the company dominates globally.
Uncovered: Network of suspected scam sites lure 'dabba' tradersIndia Today uncovers a web of suspected scammer sites posing as platforms for the "dabba" stock trade, an illegal practice.

Oh Gary, how could you: Elon Musk mocks US body amid Twitter stock probeA letter from Elon Musk's attorney, Alex Spiro, addressed to outgoing US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) Chair Gary Gensler, alleged that the agency gave Musk a 48-hour ultimatum.
Sensex, Nifty rebound to end higher; FMCG and IT stocks lead recoveryThe S&P BSE Sensex gained 843.16 points to close at 82,133.12, while the NSE Nifty50 added 219.60 points to end at 24,768.30.
EPFO key amendments: Now faster claims and more interest benefits for membersEPFO's amendments focus on reducing delays, quicker claims, and better interest benefits for its members.

Sensex gains 700 points: 3 reasons behind stock market volatility todayStock market rebound: The S&P BSE Sensex was up 730.39 points to 82,020.35, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 192.70 points to 24,741.40, as of 3 PM.

Mobikwik IPO listing: Does GMP suggest strong market debut amid heavy demand?Mobikwik IPO has seen very strong demand among investors and was fully booked within the first hour of opening for subscription.
Sensex back in green: Airtel, HUL, and IT stocks lead market rebound As of 12:52 PM, Sensex was up by 111.46 points to 81,401.42, while Nifty50 gained 12.75 points to 24,561.45.

Vishal Mega Mart IPO last day: Check gmp, subscription. Shoud you subscribe?Vishal Mega Mart IPO has set a price range of Rs 74 to Rs 78 per share. Retail investors need to purchase a minimum of 190 shares in a single lot, requiring an initial investment of Rs 14,820.
Azim Premji, Ranjan Pai to buy a minority stake in Akasa Air: ReportAzim Premji and Ranjan Pai family offices acquired a minority stake in Akasa Air as part of a $130-140 million fundraising round.
Explained: Why a credit score over 800 mattersHigh credit scores boost financial health by offering cheaper loans, and better insurance discounts, amongst others.

Gold, silver price today, December 13, 2024: Precious metals witness dip on MCXGold Price Today December 13, 2024: Both gold and silver are trading on the lower side of the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX) on Friday. Check the latest city-wise prices here.

Sensex falls 1,000 points: Key factors behind stock market weaknessStock market crash: As of 10:37 AM, the Sensex was down 1,064.37 points to 80,225.59, while Nifty was also struggling below 24,300 losing 332.10 points to 24,216.60.
Sensex, Nifty tank in early trade; inflation relief fails to lift market moodThe S&P BSE Sensex was down 540.09 points to 80,749.87, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 160.35 points to 24,388.35.

Mahila Samman Yojana: Key details about Rs 1000 schemeThe AAP government announced Mahila Samman Yojana, offering Rs 1000 monthly to women in Delhi, with a rise to Rs 2100 if it wins in the upcoming elections.

Retail inflation cools to 5.48% in November from 6.21% in OctoberHouseholds across the world's most populous country are likely to welcome the inflation relief, given that food expenses dominate many family budgets.
Sensex, Nifty end lower ahead of inflation data; bearish trend persistsThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 236.18 points to close at 81,289.96, while the Nifty50 was down 93.10 points to end at 24,548.70.
December 15 advance tax deadline: What you need to knowTaxpayers with liabilities exceeding Rs 10,000 are required to make quarterly advance tax payments to avoid penalties and interest charges.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Congress will never be able to wipe off taint of Emergency: PM in Parliament Live UpdatesPrime Minister Narendra Modi, responding to the Constitution debate, said the Congress strangled democracy by turning the country into a 'jailhouse'.

Nehru advocated for altering Constitution if it became hurdle: PM's big chargePrime Minister Narendra Modi began responding to the Constitution debate in the Lok Sabha. On the 75th anniversary of the adoption of the Constitution, PM Modi called it a moment of pride for India. The Lower House of Parliament initiated a two-day debate on the Constitution on December 13 to commemorate the beginning of the 75th year of its adoption. Earlier on Friday, the debate on the Constitution witnessed fiery speeches by Defence Minister Rajnath Singh and Wayanad MP Priyanka Gandhi. Follow India Today for all the latest updates from Parliament.

If Nitish Kumar was made INDIA bloc head, he would not have left: Omar AbdullahSpeaking at Agenda Aaj Tak, Omar Abdullah spoke about key political issues, including the leadership of the INDIA Bloc, Article 370, and relations with Pakistan.
Dr Naresh Trehan prescribes three tests that could be your 'health horoscope'Cardiologist Dr Naresh Trehan listed three essential tests that one should get done to understand their health horoscope.

Allu 'Pushpa' Arjun returns from jail even as Telangana tries to decode the Why of the arrestAllu Arjun's arrest sent shockwaves in the Telugu film industry. As the Pushpa 2 actor returns from jail, Telangana decodes the 'why' of his arrest.

Rahul Gandhi's Savarkar offensive, BJP counters with Indira Gandhi letterRahul Gandhi, participating in the debate on the Constitution in the Lok Sabha, said Hindutva ideologue Vinayak Damodar Savarkar believed the Constitution should be superseded by the Manusmriti.
Bangladesh being used to spread hate against Indian Muslims: OwaisiHyderabad MP Assaduddin Owaisi said that attack on minorities in Bangladesh was being used to spread hate against Indian Muslims.

'Meeting Jihad': Union Minister as Rahul Gandhi meets Sambhal clash victims' kinCongress leaders Rahul Gandhi and Priyanka Gandhi, on December 10, met family members of those killed in violence in UP's Sambhal after clashes broke out over a court-ordered survey at the Shahi Jama Masjid.

Singapore envoy slams Gurugram cafe for serving 'tasteless chai' in viral postSingapore High Commissioner to India, Simon Wong, slammed a cafe in Gurugram for serving him what he called a "tasteless" cup of chai.

Kangana Ranaut mocks Priyanka Gandhi's speech: Family keeps praising each otherBJP MP Kangana Ranaut contrasted Priyanka Gandhi's speech with Home Minister Rajnath Singh's address, stating that the former's speech was "rooted in data and facts" while the latter's was merely "random allegations."

UK immigration drops as student visa rules tighten, non-EU nationals leadAs the UK tightens student visa regulations, immigration figures dip, with non-EU nationals making up the majority of migrants. Indian student inflow sees a significant drop due to dependent visa restrictions.

Vishy Anand recalls first meeting with D Gukesh, shares throwback photo of workshopViswanathan Anand fondly recalled his first meeting with D Gukesh, sharing a throwback photo from a workshop. He described Gukesh as 'quiet and focused,' while Pragg was 'restless and energetic,' hinting that the seeds of WACA began there.

Vijay Deverakonda, Naga Chaitanya, others visit Allu Arjun after release from jailActor Allu Arjun returned home after getting interim bail in the Pushpa 2 stampede case. Celebrities like Rana Daggubati and Vijay Deverakonda visited him at his home.

Police missing: Akhilesh Yadav's dig at BJP's UP 'caste strategy' graphicsAkhilesh Yadav said the INDIA bloc was confident about toppling the BJP in UP in the 2027 Assembly polls. He confirmed that the Samajwadi Party would fight the elections with Congress.

Kiren Rijiju's dig at Congress: They avoided roads near border to stop encroachmentKiren Rjiju claimed that Congress did not want to build proper roads in the border areas as they feared that the initiative could facilitate the passage of army personnel from the neighbouring country into the border states.

Allu Arjun says stampede was unfortunate, 'not in my control' after leaving jailActor Allu Arjun said he would cooperate with authorities in the stampede case after walking out of a Hyderabad jail, where he spent the night following his arrest a day before.

Top doctors' prescription for Varun Dhawan's mother: Pranayam, balloonsActor Varun Dhawan discussed his mother's bronchitis and sought advice on health trends and elderly care during Agenda Aaj Tak 2024. Experts suggested simple practices like Pranayam and balloon exercises.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

3rd Test: Rain turns villain on Day 1 after another debatable Rohit Sharma callBorder-Gavaskar Trophy: Rain washed out Day 1 of the Brisbane Test after India won the toss and decided to bowl in the third Test. Rohit Sharma's decision to bowl didn't yield the right results in the end, as Australia's openers negated the early threat from the India pacers.

Who's Revanth Reddy's favourite Telugu actor? 'I'm a star myself', he saysDuring Agenda Aaj Tak, Telangana Chief Minister Revanth Reddy while talking about Allu Arjun's arrest, said, "I am a star myself, I am no one's fan."

Proposal for ban on film reviews: Threat to freedom of expression or desperation?Recently, the Tamil Film Active Producers Association (TFAPA) filed a writ petition in the Madras High Court calling for a ban on movie reviews on social media for three days since release. Can movie reviews make or break a film's theatrical run?

World Champion D Gukesh reacts to Magnus Carlsen's criticism of Ding Liren matchD Gukesh has reacted to the criticism from Magnus Carlsen about his World Chess Championship match against Ding Liren in Singapore. Carlsen questioned the quality of the match, which saw Gukesh become crowned as the new World Champion.

Didn't win any war, just made film and money: Revanth Reddy's swipe at Allu ArjunSpeaking at the Agenda Aaj Tak event, Telangana Chief Minister Revanth Reddy claimed that the police were doing their job but Allu Arjun's arrival at the theatre for the premiere without any intimation to the management as well as the police, had led to the stampede.

Red One review: Chris Evans' film is a fun yet flawed festive flickRed One review: Chris Evans' film promises a thrilling blend of action and holiday cheer. Despite its star power, the film struggles to maintain its festive spark.

Rekha hugs Amitabh Bachchan's grandson Agastya Nanda at RK Film FestivalAt the RK Film Festival, actor Rekha shared a heartfelt hug with Amitabh Bachchan's grandson, Agastya Nanda, a moment that touched the hearts of attendees and fans alike. A video of their interaction is going viral online.

Margot Robbie and Jacob Elordi's Wuthering Heights to release in 2026The much-anticipated film adaptation of Wuthering Heights, starring Margot Robbie and Jacob Elordi, has finally announced its release date. The film will hit the theatres in 2026.

Varun Dhawan regrets missing daughter's firsts, calls wife Natasha a superheroActor Varun Dhawan reflects on parenting, missing milestones with his newborn daughter, and his wife Natasha Dalal's protective instincts. He awaits the release of Baby John, his action-packed return to cinemas on December 25.

BB 18 day 66: Eisha Singh, Avinash Mishra discuss their feelings for each other  In a recent episode of Bigg Boss, Eisha Singh humorously commented on her chances of finding love outside the house, playfully blaming Avinash Mishra for the challenge. Avinash responded with a witty remark, assuring a direct approach to any future proposals.

sports.headline: Rajat Patidar 'happy' to lead RCB if given an opportunityIPL 2025: Rajat Patidar is ready to take on the role of captain at Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) if given the opportunity. RCB retained Rajat ahead of the IPL auction.

BBL 2024-25: Squads, schedule, live-streaming and all you need to knowBBL 2024-25: Five-time champion Perth Scorchers and Melbourne Stars will face each other in the opening game on December 15. 40 matches will take place in the league stage before the playoffs and final. Brisbane Heat are the defending champions.

Ange Postecoglou defends Tottenham Hotspur ownership amid club's strugglesTottenham Hotspur manager Ange Postecoglou said that the club's ownership must not be blamed for their on-field struggles. Spurs are ranked 11th in the Premier League points table after 15 games.

Tim Southee receives guard of honour in farewell Test against EnglandVeteran New Zealand pacer Tim Southee received a guard of honour from the England team on the first day of the third Test in Hamilton. New Zealand were 315 for 9 at stumps on the first day of the third Test against England.

AUS vs IND: KL Rahul shares snacks with Kohli as rain halts Brisbane TestRain disrupted Day 1 of the third Test at Brisbane, limiting play to just 13.2 overs. KL Rahul and Virat Kohli's lighthearted snack-sharing moment went viral, providing fans with some entertainment on a rain-soaked, uneventful day.

3rd Test: England hit back after New Zealand's strong start in HamiltonEngland pacers struck in the final session, reducing New Zealand to 315 for nine after the hosts made a solid start on the first day of the third and final Test in Hamilton on Saturday.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
